questions.question_text: You are working with Sam, a project manager on one of the projects within your program. Sam doesn't understand all of the rules and procedures that he's required to do as a project manager in your program. What are the rules and procedures called in project that Sam must abide by?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Project Governance: This refers to the framework, practices, and procedures specific to managing a project within a program or organization. It includes the methodologies, policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines that dictate how projects are conducted and managed. Project governance ensures that projects align with the broader goals of the program and the organization, and provides a structured approach to decision-making and accountability. It is the most applicable to Sam's role as a project manager within a program.

Enterprise Environment Factors (EEFs) include all policies, practices, procedures, and legislation that exist both inside and outside of the organization that will impact the way you manage a project.
must be Project Governance ; Enterprise environmental factors - does not have rules & regulation a

questions.question_text: You have created a control chart for a repeatable process in your program. You have discovered that the seven most recent measurements are all on the positive side of the mean in your control chart. What is this phenomenon called?

discussion.content:
C is correct
The phenomenon where the seven most recent measurements are all on the same side of the mean in a control chart is called the Rule of Seven or Seven-Point Rule. This is a common rule used in statistical process control to identify potential non-random patterns within the data.

Selected Answer: D
The outputs from this process would generally include:

Change requests: Proposals for adaptation or change based on the issues encountered.
Updates to the program issues register: Documentation and tracking of the issues identified, including their status and resolution.
Given these common outputs of issue management, the correct answer in this context would be:

D. Program issues register updates

questions.question_text:
You are the program manager for your organization. Management has assigned you to a new program that has been chartered. Your team is in the process of the
Manage Program Issues process. One of the two outputs of this process is change requests. Which one of the following is the other one?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The Configuration Management System is the component of the overall change management system that deals specifically with:

Evaluating potential changes to the project scope,
Testing those changes (where applicable), and
Documenting each approved change and maintaining version control.

Selected Answer: C
Verification to confirm

C. Scope Verification

Scope verification is the process of formalizing acceptance of the completed project deliverables. It involves reviewing, inspecting, and documenting the project work to ensure that all deliverables have been satisfactorily completed and accepted. When changes are made to the project scope, scope verification becomes crucial in evaluating and documenting these changes to confirm that they meet the specified requirements and have the desired impact on the project.

questions.question_text: What component of the change management system is responsible for evaluating, testing, and documenting changes created to the project scope?

discussion.content: Approved CR - output of this activity.

questions.question_text: Paul is the program manager for his company. He along with his team is working on the Monitor and Control Program Changes process. The process will need several inputs. Which one of the following items is NOT an input to the Monitor and Control Program Changes process in the program management?
